intro: Hedyotis tenella, commonly known as the small white geranium, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden geraniums. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Hedyotis tenella is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
